intro: Polygala persicariifolia var. punctulata, commonly known as the spotted milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to regions of Central Asia and parts of Russia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. Its flowers are often surrounded by bracts that are distinctly spotted, giving it its common name. This species is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in steppe and semi-desert environments.
